message.content:
cs.CR, cs.IR, cs.SI, cs.CY, cs.NI 

The paper discusses privacy concerns related to smart home IoT devices and proposes strategies to protect consumers from side-channel traffic rate privacy threats. This topic falls under the category of computer security (cs.CR) as well as information retrieval (cs.IR) since the paper discusses methods for concealing DNS and shaping and injecting traffic. The paper also touches upon social implications (cs.SI) of smart home technology and the need for privacy-sensitive development (cs.CY). Finally, the paper discusses network infrastructure (cs.NI) and the potential for neighborhood WiFi eavesdroppers to measure Internet traffic rates from smart home devices.
